result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Radke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With Count 2 with credit for ZERO (0) days time served.  Huber privileges for work or treatment.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HOC screening.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
*The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
*DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.

*Defendant to CONTINE participation in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
*Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

timeConds.notes: *STAYED. To be used at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas J Radke in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) MONTHS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT TO COUNT 2 with credit for ZERO (0) days time served.  Huber privileges for work or treatment.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant sentenced to serve FIVE (5) DAYS in the House of Correction CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1 with credit for ZERO (0) days time served.  Huber privileges for work or treatment.  Court approved Electronic Monitoring subject to HoC screening.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion.
* Defendant to CONTINE participation in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Doctor's Reports regarding the Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Thomas J Radke in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that they are seeking a Global Resolution with Defendant's new case.  Defense advised that Judge Davis has accepted that Br. 33 will consolidate.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Thomas J Radke in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State advised that Defendant has picked up a new charge.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a factual basis to REVOKE the DPA.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  COURT WILL ACCEPT THE OTHER MATTER INTO THIS COURT OR COURT WILL ACCEPT THE TRANSFER OF THIS CASE PENDING THE ACCEPTANCE OF ALL PARTIES.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Thomas J Radke in court with attorney David P. Geraghty who appears via telephone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.

  Review hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
(EMAIL).  Addendum to JusticePoint DPA Progress Report dated 12-14-2015.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Thomas J Radke in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Paul Hauer on behalf of Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for projected plea/sentencing hearing.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.
  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas J Radke in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel informs the Court defendant is not eligible for Drug Treatment Court. Parties are still negotiating a possible Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing hearing on 10-16-2015 at 8:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas J Radke in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for scheduling conference. Court in trial on another matter. Any motion due no later than 09-18-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing on 09-18-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Calendar call scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 07-22-2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol, POST judicial rotation.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 17.

Defendant Thomas J Radke in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg, appearing for Patricia Daugherty, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  

Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.
Clerk:  jms

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
